title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Licensing of
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Licensing of 

Drivers) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations and the Principal Regulations shall be construed 

together.

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations – 

“applicable period” means the period beginning on 1 March 2020 and 
ending on 30 June 2020; 

“Principal Regulations” means the Road Traffic (Licensing of Drivers) 
Regulations 2006 (S.I. No. 537 of 2006).
text_norm: 2 regulation - applicable period mean period beginning 1 march 2020 ending 30 june 2020 principal regulation mean road traffic (licensing drivers) regulation 2006 (s.i no 537 2006)

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: 3. Where a learner permit granted in accordance with Regulation 17 of the
text_raw:
3. Where a learner permit granted in accordance with Regulation 17 of the 
Principal Regulations expires during the applicable period, the learner permit 
shall be deemed to have been granted for an additional period of 4 months and 
the date of expiry shall be 4 months after the expiry date specified on the permit.
text_norm: 3 learner permit granted accordance regulation 17 principal regulation expires applicable period learner permit shall deemed granted additional period 4 month date expiry shall 4 month expiry date specified permit

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: 4. Where a learner permit, granted in accordance with Regulation 17 of the
text_raw:
4. Where a learner permit, granted in accordance with Regulation 17 of the 
Principal Regulations, is a permit to drive vehicles of more than one category 
and an expiry date, by category, occurs during the applicable period, the learner 
permit in respect of the category concerned shall be deemed to have been granted 
for an additional period of 4 months and its period of validity shall be extended 
by 4 months. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 14th April, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [125] 3 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Transport, 
Tourism and Sport, 
9 April, 2020. 

SHANE ROSS, 

Minister for Transport, Tourism 
and Sport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [125]

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Road Traffic (Licensing of Drivers) Regulations 
2006 (S.I. No. 537 of 2006) to provide that a learner permit that expires during 
the period beginning on the 1 March 2020 and ending on 30 June 2020 is 
extended for an additional period of 4 months from the date of expiry. This 
extension applies to all the categories listed on the learner permit from the date 
of expiry for each category. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [125] 5
